reviewText: The biggest problem I have with Bonanza is that it simply is not a very accurate potrayal of the West. First of all, Lorne Greene is only a few years older than some of his supposed sons like Pernell Roberts. Second, Ben Cartwright had these sons with 3 different wives, all different ethnicities (English, Swedish and French Creole). What, all three wives died in childbirth? wtf? And how is some dude living out on the Ponderosa in Nevada back in the 1860s finding such a variety of different ethnic women to fornicate with? The only possible conclusion is that Ben was a frequent visitor of the brothels in Virginia City and enjoyed bedding down the ladies of the night. Yet the show never really explains all this, or delves into the history. Obviously Ben had trouble keeping his 6 shooter holstered, which resulted in multiple pregnancies for the working girls of the local town. Then, comically, these sons seem to never get laid at all. You'd think Dad would have taught them something about getting some tail in town. But no, you never hear Hoss tell Little Joe that he's going into town to get laid. Nothing about broads. If you are going to make a western, at least throw in some realism. These guys lived like celibate monks while their dad was apparantly going around banging every skirt in sight, yet you hear nothing about either situation. For instance, if it was me writing the series, I would have had old Hoss traveling to Virginia City to meet up with a harlot named Scarlet's Nana only to have him get her impregnated and contract an STD from her at the same time, thus posing a real ethical and moral conundrum. Now THAT would have been an interesting show!
summary: Not an accurate potrayal of the West
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: What more can I say of all Bonanza episodes are true western tales of cattlemen living and surviving in the old wild west! Every episode grasps my attention from start to finish, and the picture quality in color is truly great! Heehaw waiting on Official Third Season to arrive Yeehaw! Yes I'm a cowgirl!
summary: Loving the Second Official Bonanza Season as much as the First
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: I now have first season 1 & 2 and second season 1 & 2 and I've read some of the reviews that customers have written praising the picture quality. But to tell the truth I find the picture to be somewhat washed out. I had just seen the episode 'silent thunder' a week ago on TV land and when I got my set I happened to view that same episode again and it just didn't seem as clear on my DVD set as it did on cable. I thought maybe it was a defected disk but all of them were like that. Is it just me or does someone else notice the same thing.
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: I love Bonanza.  To have the full season's finally available is great!  These are good quality, has the old NBC peacock logo, love the special features.  I am having fun watching all of the episodes.  If you like Bonanza ir Love Bonanza these are definitely worth buying.

reviewText: A great deal from Amazon. I only wish they would put more like this on sale. The prices the studios want for these type of series, part 1 and part 2 are just to high. I don't buy many like this because of the high price. The 5 star rating is for the product quality not a recommendation of the pricing.
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: BONANZA SEASON 2.  The Cartwrights are back again in this second season wherever they go they leave a trail of excitement,adventure and unforgettable humor,with  Ben-Lorne Greene, Adan-Pernell Roberts. Hoss- Dan Blocker and Michael Landon as Little Joe.The emotion humor and action are guaranteed in the second stage of the series,in luxurious original dvds with good sound and picture quality,all perfect.
summary: in luxurious original dvds with good sound and picture quality
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: Thanks to friends who have purchased the German-released DVD sets, I've seen many complete episodes that can't be seen here.  When I realized seasons 1& 2 were finally available in the States, I snapped them up and have no regrets. The picture quality is good and the scenes don't fade to black too soon like some other older shows recently released and the music is true and clear.  The commentary is a nice bonus that gives die-hard fans an inside glimpse of behind-the-scenes info we crave.  Frankly, even without the bonus features, I'm thrilled to own seasons 1& 2 and anxiously await the release of subsequent seasons.  Please hurry!!
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: I really enjoy watching this show. The DVD are in great shape and it arrived very quick. The great part about it is now I can watch it when ever I want and all my favorite episodes anytime I want. Thank you Amazon.
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: As I've said before and have been saying since Christmas, I'm enjoying Bonanza for the first time in my life!  Of course I remember watching it growing up but I was really just in the room  physically while my parents were actually watching and enjoying the series in 1959/60.  I was too young to care about anything but the fast draws and would get up and go play in another room when the "drama" took over.  By the time it moved to Sunday nights, I was really not interested and has purposely not watched the show since in syndication out of some misplaced snobbery about it being  "my parents show".  Well, now that my wife bought me a best of DVD I've found out what I've been missing.  As a result, I'm buying the series by Season.  I've S1, S2, & S3 of both volumes each and it's money well spent.  I will buy more but might probably give up when Pernell Roberts leaves, but then again, I was wrong before so I may ride with the Cartwright boys right to the end.The episodes were very well written and the guest stars ran the gamut from television actors to motion picture stars.  I loved the episode with Ida Lupino (great actress and director as well.  "Have Gun Will Travel" fans will know what I'm speaking about as she directed many of the episodes of that great series).  As I tend to add before I depart; when will Amazon get the John Russell, Peter Brown "Lawman" series?  I'm just waiting (however impatiently)
summary: This Review Applies to Seasons 1-3 Volumes 1 & 2 Each  -  Good Stuff Maynard!!
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: I would recommend this season to anyone it was fun seeing how Adams mom died and how well they were working with each other. I especially loved the Vengeance and the Gift.  My kids loved the Tax Collector and Bank Run.
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: Been waiting a long time for a quality version of Bonanza to be available and this is it. Anxious for the complete series to be available.
Title: Bonanza: Season 2

reviewText: I chose a four star rating because the show is that good. Bonanza set the standard for the westerns of that era.  The shows got better as time went on. You can see it in production values and the story lines. I would have given a five star rating but the picture quality on disc 2 was poor, the picture looked out of foucus.  When I watched disc three  the picture was sharper and quality good. Maybe I got a bad one but I still recommend the series. I'm a big fan of western television shows of the 60s and 70s and Bonanza is at the top of my list.
Title: Bonanza: Season 2
